etomica.util

Class HistoryCollapsingDiscard

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsing
      • etomica.util.HistoryCollapsingDiscard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    History
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HistoryCollapsingAverage

    public class HistoryCollapsingDiscard
extends HistoryCollapsing
    History that records a number of values. When existing space is insufficient to hold new data, the existing data is "collapsed" such that all existing data is stored in the first half of existing storage by dropping every other data point. After that point data will be taken half as often.

    • Field Summary

      • addValue

        public boolean addValue(double x,
                        double y)
        adds data to the history. If insufficient space exists to store the data, existing data is collapsed by 1/2 and future data is taken half as often.
